201.comments: This course focuses on algorithms for solving convex optimization problems and the implications for statistical estimation. Course topics will include convex functions; KKT conditions and subdifferentials; implications for estimators; and first-order optimization algorithms. We will also discuss path algorithms and other tricks for penalized estimators.As a prerequisite, students should have taken Stat 560 and 561, as well as a graduate level course in Probability (Stat 547C)
